poem:
Title: "In The Shadow of Nehru"

Victory through the eyes 
of Nemesis - swift redemption.
Modi steps, a third time
on this side of the aisle.

Boasting echoes in the hall
of Democracy's children,
Yet, the taste of triumph lies
bitter on his tongue.

Amidst the clamor, a whisper,
Of Nehru's footsteps long gone,
Yet louder, in the silence
of impending dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on Modi’s election disappointment: the winner is democracy in India | Editorial Nemesis has followed swift on the heels of Narendra Modi’s hubris. He is set to be the first Indian prime minister to serve a third term since its first, Jawaharlal Nehru. Yet rarely has an election victory looked more like defeat. He boasted that he would win a third full majority in the world’s largest democracy – suggesting his party would win". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
